    • getUniqueFieldValue

      public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getUniqueFieldValue​(java.io.File csvFile, java.lang.String fieldName) throws java.io.IOException
      Get a list of unique values for a given field from a .csv file
      Parameters:
      csvFile - csv file
      fieldName - name of the field to sum values
      Returns:
      a list of unique values
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • getCells

      public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getCells​(java.io.File csvFile, java.lang.String targetAttributeName, java.lang.String targetAttributeValue, java.lang.String wantedAttributeName) throws java.io.IOException
      Get the values of cells corresponding to the value of another field's cell.
      Parameters:
      csvFile - CSV File with a comma as a separator
      targetAttributeName - name of the field that will be compared
      targetAttributeValue - value of the cell that will be compared
      wantedAttributeName - name of the field of the wanted cell
      Returns:
      the value of the cells in an ArrayList
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - by CSVReader

    • getCell

      public static java.lang.String getCell​(java.io.File csvFile, java.lang.String targetAttributeName, java.lang.String targetAttributeValue, java.lang.String wantedAttributeName) throws java.io.IOException
      Get the value of a cell corresponding to the value of another field's cell. Unique result, stop at first.
      Parameters:
      csvFile - CSV File with a comma as a separator
      targetAttributeName - name of the field that will be compared
      targetAttributeValue - value of the cell that will be compared
      wantedAttributeName - name of the field of the wanted cell
      Returns:
      the values of the cell
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - by CSVReader

    • getIndice

      public static int getIndice​(java.io.File csvFile, java.lang.String fieldName) throws java.io.IOException
      Get the indice number on the position of the header of a .csv file
      Parameters:
      csvFile - .csv file with a header
      fieldName - name of the field to get indice from
      Returns:
      the indice on which number
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • calculateColumnsBasicStat

      public static void calculateColumnsBasicStat​(java.io.File csvFile, int nbCol, boolean isFirstCol) throws java.io.IOException
      Add some basic statistic for a predeterminde column of a csv file. Add extra lines to the end of the .csv.
      Parameters:
      csvFile - path to the .csv File
      nbCol - number of the column to calulate stats (begins at 0)
      isFirstCol - true if there's a header and it will be ignored
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • makeLine

      public static java.lang.String makeLine​(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> headers, java.lang.String[] line)
      Create a String out of a CSV line with only the indicated indexes. Separate the values with a "-"
      Parameters:
      headers - list of indexes to put
      line - the csv line in a tab
      Returns:
      the concatenated string

    • joinCSVs

      public static java.io.File joinCSVs​(java.io.File csvBase, java.io.File csvToJoin, java.lang.String fieldCsvBase, java.lang.String fieldCsvToJoin, boolean addNoCorrespondance, java.util.List<java.lang.String> listFieldsToJoin, java.io.File fileOut) throws java.io.IOException
      Join to CSV by searching a common value in predefined fields. The whole line of the base csv is copied and only the precised fields of the toJoin .csv are copied.
      Parameters:
      csvBase - File that will be copied in a whole
      csvToJoin - File to join
      fieldCsvBase - Filed of the base file to make the join
      fieldCsvToJoin - Filed of the ToJoin file to make the join
      addNoCorrespondance - If correspondance between base and toJoin not found, do we still copy the base line ?
      listFieldsToJoin - List of fields from the ToJoin file to copy
      fileOut - File where to write the output
      Returns:
      the wrote new CSV file
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - Reading and writing files
